inn1.comm: little bit of shape away but Amla shuffles across and blocks it towards point. Steady start
nicely timed by Amla, but he can't beat the man at cover. Didn't look to hit it too hard. Just feeling things out
this time off the front foot as Malinga pushes it full and gets it to move away just a hint. Gorgeous sound off the bat as he drives to cover
saw this on middle and went for the flick through midwicket, but the seam away takes the leading edge and the ball scurries away to third man
on the pads but de Kock can't put it away. Goes for the flick to a gentle half-volley and finds square leg
that's a beauty! Searing yorker that curves in on middle. De Kock is up to it though. A first over full of either side not wanting to give anything away
starts off with a shortish delivery and Amla uses the width on it to punch through a diving short cover. Hurries across to the other end
no half measures there. Too much width there and he rocks back to cut through point. Clean strike
what a riposte! This had seam, bounce and is just unplayable. Goes fuller and draws him forward. De Kock had to line covered, but then the ball moved away. Too good even to get the outside edge
little bit of away movement again and De Kock shuffles across to block gingerly
seeks that big away swinger again, but this one doesn't oblige. De Kock looks to whip the full delivery on leg stump away, but gets struck on the pads
back of a length and outside off, Hash punches it down to mid-off
misses the yorker, doesn't happen often. De Kock knows that as he capitalises on the full toss with a drill down the ground. No big follow through, he just looked to present the straight bat
another low full toss, think this was the slower ball. De Kock was fooled. Had to take the bottom hand off the bat as he finds short cover
three in a row! But this time De Kock can't find the gap. Full toss on the pads, the flick finds midwicket
more variation from Malinga. And it's just the third over. Offcutter on a good length outside off, De Kock waits for it and dabs to third man
thuds into the ground as Amla looks to lace this shortish and wide delivery through the covers. Hasn't timed it as well as he would have liked
digs it in and Amla has pummeled this to the square leg boundary. Comfortably on the back foot and he swivels on it to pull well in front of square
not as much width on it as he thought. De Kock looks to steer it behind square, but this good length ball ducks back in on off stump
kept on the fuller side as de Kock comes forward and pushes into the covers

has to play around his pad again, but like before this ball had pitched outside leg. Kulasekara needs to get his line right with those fuller balls. We are playing with DRS and bowler and captain were discussing the prospect of a second opinion. Decide against it
nicely played. Took the fuller ball off the stumps and slit the gap between cover and point.
strays on the pads again but de Kock is circumspect as he nudges to square leg
gets rapped on the pads again. Kula is looking for that big outswinger that starts from leg stump and takes the edge through to the slips. Perhaps trying a little too much there
tossed up outside off, Amla looks to go leg side but gets a leading edge to short cover
lovely, loopy offspinner and Amla blocks it back to the bolwer
pulls his length back a touch and this one goes on with the arm. Might have been the carrom ball. Amla goes to cut and misses
goes deep in his crease and blocks in front of the stumps
another leading edge from Amla. Doesn't carry to the bowler. Again, this flighted delivery turns the other way
calmly worked down to mid-on
good swing for Kula, but this time he's started it a little too straight for the right-hander. Amla wanted to glance it away and gets enough pad on it to run away to the long leg boundary
good length ball just outside off. The inswing beats the batsman forceful drive on the up. Goes past the inside edge to the keeper
tails in again off a fuller length, Amla whips is behind square. Was uppish but too wide of the man inside the circle
this one goes away as he keeps it on a fuller length. Amla decides to let it go
very little footwork there from Amla and the hint of away movement beats his crunch through the covers
flummoxed off the front foot. Kula has got his line and length right after a few tries. Lures the batsman into a drive on the up and beats the outside edge
flighted on off stump, de Kock blocks.
gets forward and pushes this tossed up delivery down to long-off
lunges forward to block, but he gets an outside edge that dribbles away past slip. Good that he played with soft hands, but Amla is not looking comfy out there
stays back and seeks to punch through the covers. No timing
reaches the pitch this time and pushes down the ground
launches into a dive to his right and his height helps him keep de Kock's push down the ground to nothing. Nice work from Senanayake
a little nip back in, but Amla's solidly behind this. Straight bat finds mid-off
a little more width on this, Amla wants to exploit it but he strikes the back of a length delivery on the inside half of the bat
much better timing here. Pounces on the width on offer as he slices it in front of point. Pulls up just inside the boundary
not quite full enough to get forward and Amla goes hard with his hands as well. Gets an inside edge onto pad
lures him into a drive again, Amla pushes to mid-off
that was sweet. Such lovely hands from Amla as he punches this fuller ball outside off into the covers
eases this flighted delivery wide of long-off
plants his front foot on off stump and drags this tossed up delivery from outside it's line towards long-on
he's had trouble handling Senanayake before, but now he dances down the track, reaches the pitch and then heaves it over midwicket. Magnificent strike
knew this would be shorter so he was waiting on the back foot. Goes for the cut, but misses. Nearly catches the outside edge, but de Kock was more concerned with not putting that away
slices this square on the off side, but Kula at point lets it go through him. Has enough timing to reach the boundary. Bonus for de Kock and South Africa
pushes forward to block and gets an inside edge as this flighted ball turns into him
covers the line of this good length ball on off stump and blocks
gets forward and blocks the full delivery that ducks back in at him.
he's realised inswing is Kulasekara's stock ball and is waiting for it. Plays the forward defensive nice and late on middle
this was shortish and outside off, but Amla had walked across outside off. Neatly timed by Amla, but the short fine leg fielder dives to his left and saves four. Kusal is the man
fine leg comes into play again, but this time it's off a streaky inside edge. Amla looks to force it against the seam and his cover drives goes almost 180 degrees away from where he intended it
solid punch to mid-off. This was a length ball and de Kock imbued a lot of power into it
whipped away off his toes. Seemed to tail in a touch as he settles into a fuller length on middle
misses out there. Mathews angles it across the left-hander who goes for a dab behind point. Beaten
keeps it back of a length and tucks him up on off stump, de Kock short-arm pulls it to deep midwicket
teases him outside off, Amla drills it through to the sweeper on the off side.
nothing more than a defensive push, but he's placed it wide of the man at cover to bring up South Africa's fifty
picked the slower ball and glanced it off his legs to long leg. Just the kind of pace to get Amla into his stride
enough flight on that for Amla to press forward and nudge down to long-on
gets an inside edge on this as he expected the flighted ball to turn across him. It kept its line and long leg gets a workd out
one for the bloopers there. Mendis swerves it way down leg. Keeper can't get across to rein it in
wristily pushes the pitched up ball back to the bowler
gets forward to defend into the covers. Wanted a quick single, but the fielder was too quick
he's trying to play as late as possible. This had a bit of air and he came forward and worked it down to lon-on
a little too full from Mendis again and de Kock retains strike with a flick to long-on
deceived him with the slower ball. It was full and pushed outside off. De Kock was set up for the booming cover drive, but gets an inside edge towards midwicket
change of pace again, but this time de Kock is tighter. Plays with an open place a lot closer to the body. Finds point
third man was too enticing there. Mathews goes seam up and keeps it in the corridor. De Kock goes for a late cut and is lucky not to get a feather through to the keeper
off the front foot this time! Nips away off the deck as Mathews employs a bit of an offcutter. Soundly beaten

he's chopped it on! Mathews has a gleeful smile on his face. This was full and wide outside off. De Kock set up for the cover drive again, but played too early. This is a slow pitch, remember. Good strike for Sri Lanka. End of a sparkling little innings from de Kock
strides forward and blocks the good length ball to end a wicket maiden
drifting down leg again, too far for Amla to connect with the glance
stays back in his crease and reads the good length non-spinner off the deck. Flicked to deep square leg

plumb in front! Kallis bags a duck! This was the carrom ball and the batsman has not read it at all. Plays all around it as he looks to nudge it through midwicket and is struck on the back pad as the ball pitches and turns away,. Would have clattered into middle and off

teases him outside off and gets it to turn away again. AB may have been sucked in as he pushes forward to defend. But I think he pulled his bat back. Query for a stumping, but the his back foot was firmly rooted the the crease
flighted outside off and this one turns in at him, AB pushes down to long-on
and he's in play straight away, Hash pushes the flighted ball down the ground
goes back to the one that turns away, was pitched a little short and Amla had set up for the cut. But he hasn't got the pace of the pitch yet
tries to get this up to the batsman's chest, but AB has no trouble with it as he pulls to square leg
slower ball on middle, Amla gets set around off stump and nurdles it to long leg
fullish and outside off, AB defends watchfully
lovely strike that. This was a touch overpitched and AB gets forward confidently and drives to cover
he's picked the gap this time. Bit more width as Sri Lanka try to tempt AB outside off. But that only allows him to lean into the drive in front of point
pulls his length back but again Mathews goes a little too far outside off
opens the face on impact with the fuller ball outside off. Single to the sweeper
loopy delivery on the pads, AB works it away to deep midwicket
that was risky. Amla drills a drive to mid-off and sets off. Mathews was the fielder but he can't hit the target.
tossed up just outside off, AB steers it past point
pulls his length back so the batsman can't reach the pitch.l Amla works it to midwicket off the back foot
lashed out and muscled to the long-off boundary. Nothing of Amla's usual grace in that shot as he saw the flight and threw everything he had on it. Probably why he didn't time it well
nudged away behind square leg to retain strike
back of a length, Amla works it from outside off towards square leg
on the pads again and AB is content to have it dribble off towards the leg side for an extra
fullish and outside off, Amla leans into a cover drive. Little uppish though.
change of pace here and Amla has no trouble nudging it to midwicket and stealing a single
more pace off the ball and AB blocks with soft hands in front of point and hustles across to the other end. He's faced only 11 balls, but already he's looking quite accomplished
on the corridor again and Amla dabs it away to cover point
tossed up outside off, Amla is forward towards extra cover
too early into a flick was Amla and he gets a leading edge to the carrom ball
this one turns in to Amla, who rocks back and looks to cut. Again very little timing
well flighted and Amla sought to take advantage as he planted a big stride forward and unleashed a booming cover drive. Senanayake at cover dives to his left and pulls out an amazing save.
flighted on and around middle and it turns into AB, gets an inside edge onto pad
shortish and just outside off, AB is waiting on his back foot and cuts strongly through the covers. Malinga has a lot of work to to from cover point and does well. Good dive there to save a single
a good length ball moving away a bit outside off stump, gently played out square
shuffles across, takes this length ball from around off stump and clips it through midwicket
has the width outside off stump now and drives, but will get only one to the sweeper
even more width for Amla now, moving further away too, he tries a big front-foot drive, does not time it, and it goes in the air through extra cover
helped down to long leg for a single
well bowled, seemed to hold the line as it pitched good length on off, Amla wanted to work it to leg, but got a leading edge that rolled to extra cover
fullish delivery driven to extra cover

dropped, AB survives, he made room and tried to loft down the ground, did not time it as he wasn't really to the pitch of the straightening delivery, it was in the air for a long time, and Mathews ran forward from mid off, he dived and got hands to the ball, but it popped out
turned through midwicket for a single
played out to the off side
Amla succeeds where AB couldn't, this was much fuller from Mendis and outside off, and Amla lofted it cleanly over mid off
leans forward to work it to midwicket
moving away from just outside off, he taps it to the right of point for a single
Amla has the room to flash at this length ball and he hits it past extra cover's dive, and the sweeper has plenty of running to do

short, headed down the leg side, Amla tries to hook, Sanga goes up immediately for caught behind, umpire Davis says no, Mathews decides to review, does not seem to be anything obvious on replays, no sound too, and in the absence of HotSpot, it gets more difficult for the third umpire, Amla stays on
short once again, but straighter this time, and Amla pulls comfortably, out to deep square
slow and very full on the pad, AB nudges it square

digs it in still shorter to Amla, who decides to let it go. Malinga had gone back to his mark and the umpires hadn't stopped him, but the information comes through in the end and the bowler relents with a smile
calmly worked away off his toes behind deep square leg
he's getting out of his shell now! This was an inviting half-volley with as much width as the batsman could possibly ask for. Launched over extra cover
flatter delivery on leg stump, Amla is not quick enough with his flick and has to settle for a leg bye
moves outside leg and Mendis follows him. Defended behind point
the back leg wanders outside leg to begin the double bluff and then gets back in line with middle. Mendis tosses it up and is driven down the ground
eases the pitched up ball into the covers
leans into a drive to mid-off and they're able to sneak a quick single.
plays the angle as the good length ball is steered to third man. Couple of runs, not much turn for Priayanjan.
he's beat him! And that was pretty close to the off stump too. Another ball that goes on with the arm and the dab to third man doesn't work

dropped, both batsmen are lucky to still be out there now. Amla wanted to reach his fifty with a big six striaght down the ground, but his timing deserted him. Got it right off the bottom of the bat and Thisara running in from long-on can't hold on
good length ball on and around off stump, AB goes for a reverse sweep. Not quite the length for it
keeps it flat on middle and leg, Amla punches it back to the bowler
flighted outside off, Amla whips it away to deep square leg
good length ball outside off, AB drives on the up but can't beat a five-man strong off side infield
so he works the flighted delivery from off stump to deep midwicket
can't connect with the whip through midwicket. Gets into the shot too early and I think that drifted in a little
that's how to deal with spinners in the powerplay. Came down the track to get to the flighted ball on the full and smokes it through extra cover
smites this right off the middle as this one is a little short and a little wide. There is protection at deep point though
that flick had all the elements that make Amla so good to watch. Solid base, high back lift, quck wrists and the ball whistles away to deep midwicket
on a good length around the off stump, AB dabs into the cover for a quick single
take that! While AB was content with just a single, Amla presses forward and drills a good length ball on fifth stump through extra cover. Malinga has a right to feel unlucky there
pulls off all the pace from this offcutter. Finds the blockhole on off stump. Amla won't be fooled and is alert enough to snatch a single
another slower ball, this one ends up a full toss on middle. AB works it wide of mid-on
cautious footwork from AB as he gets to off stump to work a length ball away. The flick goes in the air, but midwicket is quite deep
the front foot reaches the pitch of the flighted ball on middle to enable his nudge through midwicket
confident step down the track and he tucks it away through the leg side for a single
tossed up and eased to long-on with a straight bat
another swift foray down the track and AB whips this wide of long-on
presses forward and drives calmly to long-off

fine leg was inside the circle and Amla was targeting that opportunity. Shuffled across to off stump and those supple wrists helped him take a delivery from off stump and find the only man inside the circle. Malinga thought he had a chance at leg before, and he did. But Amla's hands were too quick
sublime! Stood up tall on the back foot and punched it through the covers. Sliced it through the gap like hot knife through butter
whips off his hips through midwicket
opens the face and punches this good length ball through to deep point
ventures fuller and Amla drives to extra cover. He's already found that gap twice in this powerplay

has AB got another life here?! Yes, a direct hit could have had him traipsing back to the pavilion. Another flick from Amla as he looked to beat short fine leg off a low full toss on leg stump. Doesn't find the placement he wanted. They go the a dodgy single and despite AB's big dive, that would have been very dicey
punched down the ground off the back foot. He's starting to play straight and that's usually a little tough on a slow pitch.
loses his length there and allows AB to rock back and pull to deep square leg
easy single as the ball angles down leg and turns further. Flick finds square leg
tossed up around off stump, AB drives nicely to the left of mid-off
pushed down to long-on with a dead straight bat
a touch short and AB has pulled this well in front of square. Deep midwicket mops up

that's brilliant from AB! Played it quite late, which was the key. The new bowler, Priyanjan, had no clue and by the time he had sent his flighted delivery down, AB had got into position and smoked it away
goes for another, but this one was flatter on a good length and AB can only let it slide off the face for a single
pushed just a little wide of the bower, but Priyanjan dives and gets to it. Great athleticism
races down the track and hoists him over mid-off. South Africa are getting a move on here.
moves around in his crease to try and put the bowler off and then pulls out the big slog sweep to deep midwicket
effortlessly turned away to deep midwicket as this offspinner was flighted on middle
more work for deep midwicket after Senanayake goes around the wicket. Simple flick from Amla this time
bowls over the wicket to AB but his radar is wrong. Pushed down leg
tossed up outside off, AB is on the front foot and unfurls a compact drive
pushed down to long-off and this partnership has crossed 100. Excellent recovery from South Africa
good length ball holds up on the pitch and makes AB's punch down to long-on go uppishly.
waits on this flatter ball on leg stump and nudges it to square leg
starts off with a slower ball and AB tries to ride whatever pace that was on it to third man. He's going run-a-ball here
fullish and just outside off, Amla blocks to point
tries to walk at him and Malinga employs a shorter ball. Amla whips it away to long leg
he's been duped by a slower ball, but Mathews aborts the appeal realising the fuller ball that missed his flick and hit his pad would have drifted down leg
back of a good length on off stump, AB is forward and pushes to mid-on
came at the bowler, who changed his pace and length. AB isn't too perturbed as he knocks it down behind point and collects a single
stays in his crease and tucks the shortish ball to midwicket

he's combating the slowness of the pitch by rushing down the track. Making his own pace as he drives through the line to deep cover. Fifty for AB, and it takes a while for him to realise it. Finally raises his bat to the dressing room
good length ball on off stump, dabs it towards point and they rush off for a quick single
goes short and keeps it around off stump, AB sways away
back of the hand slower ball, but the variation backfires as AB stays beside it and laces a drive through the covers
a little bit of indiscipline as he oversteps. AB jogs across for a single to long-on and Amla will take the free hit

offers up a length ball and Amla tucks into it with a blitz down to the sight screen. The front foot came down but did not want to get in line with the ball as he preferred to have a free swing of the arms
decent length and line, AB presents a straight bat to long-on
oh, Dilshan doesn't pick up the ball. Raced in from point as he saw the batsmen set off for a quick single. It would have been risky, but the fielder didn't collect. Nice soft hands from Amla though
good length ball on the stumps, defended
gets an inside edge to the back of a length delivery outside off. Was looking for long-off and instead finds the bowler

don't try the slower ball with me, says AB with a gorgeous strike into the crowd behind long-off. Contender for shot of the innings. AB doesn't move, stands back and admires. Free flow of that straight bat
dabs away to third man as the Sri Lanka captain persists with a change of pace. This one was much shorter than the previous ball though
fooled him into drifting down leg by some preemptive footwork. Sweeps it quite fine, but doesn't time it as well
he's so quick with his feet! Reaches the pitch in a flash and drills it through the gap at extra cover. Forget JP and Miller, AB's turning it on
flighted on middle and leg, nudged wide of long-on
defended down the pitch as this is pushed quicker and flatter on middle
what's going on with Sri Lanka? Another lazy wide down the leg side and the keeper fails to collect. Lots of silly mistakes so far
inches forward and eases it to deep mdiwicket and walks the single
another poor delivery as Mendis pushes a short ball way outside off
ends the over with a flighted ball on the pads that's clipped to deep midwicket
drops it a touch short and Amla whips it away to deep square leg
flighted on middle, and AB pushes back to the bowler
misses his length again and AB rocks back to pull to deep midwicket
looped up just outside off and Amla drives to cover
dances down the track but finds mid-off with the booming drive
forces the bowler to go flatter and Amla collects a single to deep midwicket
whipped wide of midwicket
long-on gets some work again as Amla comes down with a straight bat down on a tossed up ball outside off
flighted outside off, Amla drives to deep cover
horrible ball from Mendis. Dropped it so short the first pitch was almost in his half. AB had premeditated a pull and gets a couple to deep midwicket. Mistimed there
flighted delivery on middle, he drills it back to the bowler

oh dear! he's chipped it to long-off! He's looked excellent since the moment he came out to bat and that partnership with Amla has put South Africa on top. But this was a simple, good length ball that he chose to hit over the top. But having decided that, he should have hit it harder than that. Almost picked out the fielder
tossed up on off stump, defended off the front foot
rocks back as he saw the length shorter and punches through to long-off
stifling Amla with a leg stump line doesn't seem too clever. He uses those wrists to flick the shortish ball to long leg
again, on the pads but this time Amla's flick doesn't connect
drifts it outside off but the length is short again. Amla backs away and thumps it behind point
calmly worked through the square leg region as they feed him on leg stump
clipped off his pads for a single through square leg
nicely tossed up and Duminy is quite content to drive down the ground to long-off
flighted on off stump and Amla picks his single with a dead bat to long-off. Moves to 98, wonder why there aren't more people to put pressure on him as he approaches a ton
incites the drive and Duminy obliges, finds long-off again
eased away behind square leg off his pads
shortish but too close to off stump for that cut shot to fetch any runs
that's his hundred! He had to battle hard early on, mistIming a few of his drives because of the slowness of the pitch. Now he eases a flighted ball down the ground to reach a well-composed century.
tossed up on the stumps, pushed to long-off
loopy delivery outside off, Amla drives to short cover
good length ball on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
goes deep in his crease and flicks it to deep square leg
a little short and he backs away to punch into the covers
skips down the track, but Mendis is wise to the strategy as he pulls his length back and makes him defend
pulls out the lap sweep. Good percentage shot with Mendis using a middle and leg line
Tossed up just outside off, Duminy looks for a drive but the ball was too full to get under
nudged away to deep midwicket
slammed to the deep midwicket boundary. Thumping sweep shot to a flighted ball on off stump
tosses this one further outside off and Amla looked to scythe it through the covers. Beaten
induces an inside edge and the ball thuds into the turf and bounces over the stumps.
tossed up on middle as he goes around the wicket to the right-hander as well. Gets a leading edge as he flicks too early
tries to whip a length ball away towards long leg, but misses out
well bowled there. Tosses it up on middle and gets it to turn into him. Amla rides it to pick up a single through midwicket
flighted on middle, defended stoically
goes deep in his crease but his punch can't beat the cover field
this one's the leggie and Amla flashes hard. Can't connect, but Sanga takes a good take outside off. Whips the bails off, but the batsman had his back foot planted inside the crease
flighted on middle, Amla works this away to deep midwicket
scampers down the pitch to nudge a tossed up delivery on the pads wide of long-on
makes room outside leg and launches this good length ball through the covers. Lots of work for Thirimanne as he runs to his left and keeps it to a couple.

huge blow! Amla was trying to be cheeky as he moved well outside off stump. But Mendis sends this nice and full. Too full to sweep, which was what Amla tried to do and is caught in front of middle. Massive innings, but South Africa's finishers have to make sure it translates into a good total
goes flatter on leg stump to push Miller onto the back foot. Flicked to midwicket
nicely flighted on off stump to keep Duminy to a forward defensive
comes down the track, but Senanayake doesn't give him the flight he wants. Forced to block again
stays right back in his crease this time and he opens the face to punch through the covers
comes forward and blocks down the pitch
this was slower and draws the batsman forward. But not quite full enough to drive. Miller gets an inside edge towards fine leg
Duminy is far more comfortable against spin. Advances again and clips through midwicket
driven solidly through to long-off
that's the trouble for a new batsman. Miller goes through with a drive through the covers, but the  ball holds in the pitch and takes the inside half of the bat to dribble down the ground
down the track again and Duminy pushes down the pitch
they take a late call to go for two. Duminy was hesitant as he saw his partner slip, but Miller wants the extra run. Drive to long-off ends up being two
a touch shorter this time and Duminy stands up tall to punch to long-off
bit of width and Miller slices it to deep point
short and wide, not difficult for the batsman to cut to deep point
good length ball as Duminy comes forward to push down the ground. Runs into a diving Senanayake

he's given it away! Wonderful bowling from Senanayake though. Lovely flight and the batsman couldn't resist from pulling out the drive. But he couldn;t quite reach the pitch and ended up scooping the ball to short cover. Good, low catch from Dilshan too

shortish and a little wide, Miller waits on it and cuts nicely. Thinks he's done enough to beat Mathews at point, but the Sri Lankan captain throws himself at the ball that was almost past him on his right. Excellent fielding
flighted delivery outside off, left alone
gets forward and nudges the flighted ball from middle to square leg
there's deep cover in place so this slice off the back foot won't hurt too much
little bit of turn there as the flatter, good length delivery takes the outside edge as McLaren tries to defend
this time the flatter ball is pitched quite short and McLaren takes ample advantage. Gets back and pulls strongly to the midwicket boundary
tossed up now outside off and McLaren drives to short cover
action replay of the last ball. Finds short cover with a punch
tossed up and this time McClaren places the ball to the left of the close man catching in the covers
keeps it nice and tight on middle. Defended
good length ball just outside off, McLaren shuffles across and turns it away through midwicket
whipped away off the front foot through square leg. Sri Lanka are persisting with spin, even part-time spin because this is a slow pitch and new batsmen can't get into their stride too easily
tossed up on middle, driven to long-on
backs away and cuts through to the sweeper

this is a flatter delivery on middle, McLaren goes for the sweep and positions himself in front of all three stumps. Gets struck on the midriff as he misses the shot. Big appeal, but the umpire doesn't budge
skips down the track and whips it through to deep midwicket.
a touch short there and Miller slashes it through the covers
this one goes on with the arm and Miller nudges it wide of long-on. Collects a couple, well run
tossed up a little too high but McLaren has wound up a little too much and comes down a little too hard, Gets an inside edge to fine leg
excellent shot to a poor ball. Full on leg stump and Miller sweeps it between square leg and short fine leg. Power and placement
this is even better. he's brought out the reverse sweep and beaten short third man by miles. Strong shot again from Miller and that makes it 14 off the over
runs down the track and lofts him over extra cover. Magnificent strike from Miller. Made sure he had all the room he needed and a full swing of the arms helped the ball over the ropes
touch shorter and it might have kept low too. Miller goes for the pull, gets an inside edge to fine leg
pushes it into the covers for a single
in the slot for that slog sweep and McLaren obliges. Mathews' experiment with part-time spinners hasn't worked here
punched through the covers to retain strike
finds the yorker, but it's a little too far down the off side. McLaren lashes but can't reach
low full toss, rather close to that wide line again. Bunted down to long-off

launched over extra cover! Miller likes to slam it in the V, but this time he's taking a little liberty with where that arc ends. This was asking to be hit though, overpitched from Malinga as he went for the wide yorker
that's nearly the perfect yorker, threatening middle stump. But Miller opens the face and sneaks a single through the covers. Fifty partnership off only 31 balls. Excellent work from these two
finds the yorker again outside off, McLaren digs it out and gets an inside edge to long-on. South Africa raise 300, applause from the coaching staff.
homes in on the base of middle, whipped to long-on for a single. Not much more he could have done with that
in the lot again and McLaren has smashed it down the ground. Mid-on was up and he had to hurtle after the ball which lobbed him comfortably. Pulls it back just inside the rope with a diving effort

inn2.comm: strikes his usual back of a length with a little shape into the left-hander. Blocked by Kusal
sumptuous drive from Kusal! This was a little fuller with a little width and he punches it through the covers. AB races after it and pulls it back, but that was struck very sweetly
nipe away from the bat this time as he strikes a good length. Beats Kusal all ends up and then points at his elbow seemingly asking if the batsman had any trouble sighting the ball now
back of a length and pushing across the left-hander, Kusal looks to cut but misses
full and curling in at him, Kusal looks to drive on the up and inside edges it on this front pad
change of pace there, but it was still at 120 kph. Slides this one down the leg side though
nice and tight on middle and Kusal presents a straight bat off the back foot
seeks his toes first up, but Dilshan was able to tuck it to midwicket.
fullish on and around middle stump, Kusal blocks carefully
back of a length and he works it off his hips for a quick single to midwicket
flashing blade of Dilshan comes down on a full and wide one, but he can't beat point
good length on off stump, Dilshan wants a single into the on side but the South African infield is quite agile
gets on the back foot to try and pierce the gap to the right of short cover, but mid-off runs across to cut his hopes of a single
a touch of inswing as he starts it on middle, Kusal's whip finds midwicket
fullish and pushed across him, Kusal strides forward to block. As ever, he is playing with quite hard hands. Lusty sound off the bat

was that dropped? Would be harsh to call that a chance. This was short and rising past the batsman's midriff. Kusal pulls and McLaren leaps to his left. He was in mid-air when his left hand made contact with the ball, but it bursts through. Steyn applauds the effort. Saved a certain four
fullish and outside off, punched down the ground
gets it well in front of square this time. Steyn's pace doesn't seem to be bothering him and this time the short ball doesn't rise. The pull shot just screamed away to the midwicket boundary
back of a length and outside off, punched to short cover
that seemed to have bounced more than the batsman expected. It was back of a length but Dilshan comes forward and opens the face. The ball strikes high on his blade and goes down to third man
poor line for the left-hander. Full and on the pads, Kusal only had to put a little bat on it. Beats fine leg on his right
back of a good length, defended down to mid-on
keeps to the corridor outside off, Kusal punches to mid-on

ducks back in off the seam and it raps Kusal on the front pad rather high. Seemed a little slow on his flick. It was a bad choice of shot anyway, but this would have sailed over the stumps. Appeal not obliged
ripper there from big Vern! Eases this across the left-hander on a good length. The diet of inswingers makes him poke but the outside edge does not manifest
he's bowling an excellent line here. Dilshan has to stride forward and defend this lest he loses his middle stump. The ball thuds into the pitch and lobs over the bowler for a single
just short of a good length and Kusal is settled on the back foot and punches to cover.
hacked away over straight midwicket. One-bounce four that would not please Steyn one bit. It was a decent delivery on off stump, but Kusal slapped it across the line and stood back and watched
fullish and outside off, Kusal pushes it to mid-off
full and teasing outside off, Kusal goes for a drive to mid-off. It's uppish but falls well short of AB
another one-bounce four! He's enjoying Steyn's extra pace here. Another short ball that sits up and Kusal powers it away with an authoritative pull
he doesn't have to do more than that. Dilshan nudges past midwicket for a quick single
he's been struggling with the right-left combination. Strays down leg to Kusal and he just clips it off his pads to the fine leg boundary. Very deftly done
short-armed pull as he takes this from outside off. There is a man in the deep at square leg, but Kusal is looking to dictate terms here
that's the Philander that South Africa want. Gets the ball to jag away after pitching and beat Dilshan's push outside off
ducks this one back in to get Dilshan's inside edge. Couple to long leg
fullish on off stump, Dilshan tucks it towards mid-on and retains strike. Excellent work by the openers here
watchfully left alone as this is dug in back of a length outside off
slaps the ball into the turf as he looks to drive on the up. Morkel sticks to back of a good length just outside off
short and wide, no need to ask Dilshan twice. Cut away almost unconsciously to the point boundary
goes a touch fuller and gets this to angle in. Dilshan blocks back to the bowler. But it isn't a tame one. Hard hands and he took a few steps searching for a single. Sri Lanka are on the hunt
flays outside off and he gets a single as cover needs to run to his left to pull this in
bouncer and it slides down the leg side. Kusal goes for the pull, but it's a little too wide and short for him. Appeal for caught behind, but it doesn't distract the ump
back of a length and outside off, Kusal stands up tall and punches in front of point
first example of indiscipline from South Africa. Comfortably no-ball from Philander, though it was a good length ball on off stump. Single towards point
digs it in and gets it to rise towards the batsman's chest. Saw Kusal was making room and followed him too. Gloves a pull to the keeper, who ensures it doesn't go away for four
this is on off stump, but a little short. Kusal pulls off the front foot to the square leg boundary
clipped off his knees and that's Sri Lanka's fifty in double quick time
attempts a slower ball, but it ends up a full toss. Kusal rather graciously punches it to mid-on with one hand. Think he wasn't expecting that
back of a length on off stump, Kusal unveils a straight-bat punch. Philander gets to it and feigns a throw

he's picked out short fine leg! It was another slower short ball, rather like the one for the free hit. Kusal pivots on the back foot and pulls, but he's hit it off a bit of a top edge and lobbed a low catch to Morkel at short fine leg. Big unit needed to dive forward and did well. Claims it straight away, but Kusal wants to wait. The umpires consult each other, then throw it to the third ump who has a simple enough decision
back of good length, but Dilshan skips down the track and drives on the up into the covers
good length ball just outside off, Dilshan pushes to mid-off and runs
what a way to get off the mark! Lovely straight bat and a checked punch to send it scurrying to the long-off boundary. Not a bad ball from Philander, but that just was a great shot
back of a length, Sanga stays back and blocks with soft hands. Looks for the single, but it isn't there
clipped off his hips to long leg

it was AB at long-on who was hurtling in to try and make something out of nothing. This was a nudge down the ground which would have always been a single, but AB forces Dilshan into a dive and a tumble
lovely start for McLaren. Good length ball that lures Dilshan to fish outside off. The ball nips away off the seam and could easily have taken the outside edge
this time it does take the outside edge, but the ball skirts close to ground towards point. Good fullish length outside off from McLaren
fullish on off stump, Dilshan wants to nudge it to long-on but gets a bit of a leading edge back down the pitch. Not the first time we've seen this today
the back foot defensive gains momentum after thudding into the pitch and sails over the bowler. Single as mid-on and mid-off run across to cut it off
good length ball on middle and leg, clipped wide of mid-on
nice and tight on off stump fetches a forward defensive
starts with a bit of a flatter ball outside off, not much turn as Sanga cuts to point
loops it up on the pads and it's been whipped through square leg
too much flight there as the full toss is mistimed to long-off
down the track, ensures he has all the room to smash this through the covers. Beats the infield and the man in the deep. Perfect placement
and again. Puts on his dancing shoes and laces this down the track. Morkel at long-on keeps it to a couple
worked away to midwicket
he's bowling beautifully here. Beats Sanga this time. Gets a little bit of movement off the pitch as he angles a good length ball acorss him. Dicey drive on the up

ventures down the track and McLaren shortens his length. Sanga dabs it into the off side and looks up at his partner for a run. Dilshan agrees, but they were almost on a collision course until the correction came at the right time
full and a little bit of width, Dilshan lashes it to the sweeper
it's the left-handers turn to pierce the cover field. Lovely-looking drive from Sanga again as he takes advantage of a full delivery
full and angled into Dilshan, who goes for a flick and gets struck on the pads
a little too close to cut, especially when the ball hints at shaping back in. The ball sneaks under Dilshan's blade
too much width there and Sanga has sliced it behind point. Flowing drive for a couple, opened the face at the last minute to get his placement right
low full toss on middle, Sanga whips it down to deep midwicket
that was the wrong 'un, I think, but Dilshan raced down to the pitch and smothered it to the long-off boundary
another googly, again picked by Dilshan as he waits on his back foot and cuts to point
turns a flighted delivery into a full toss with some sparkling footwork and then crashes it past the diving extra cover fielder
offers a friendly full toss and Dilshan tucks in with a slog over midwicket. Terrible bowling from South Africa's specialist spinner
back of a length but on the pads, Sanga wanted to glance it fine but has to be content for a leg by through square leg
worked away to the right of a wide mid-on, nicely judged single despite AB being the man doing the fielding
pulls his pace off that fuller ball on off stump, defended into the off side
good length delivery on off stump, didn't have much pace in that either, Sanga chops it to point again
the fielders are all on the 30-yard circle so this miscue fetches an easy single. Fullish delivery angled across him, Sanga goes for a drive on the up but gets an inside edge but still profits
too early into the pull as McLaren goes a touch short. Dilshan was on the front foot and perhaps that threw him off. He's bowling a nice pace on this pitch
short delivery, but Sanga rises with it and guides it from outside off down to third man
digs it in again and angled it into Dilshan, who manages to pull and keep it down to long leg

he's duped Sanga here, but mid-off was too deep. Well-disguised slower ball pitched up to the batsman gets him into a drive too early. The ball lobbed up and hung in the air for such a long time, but the fielder was too deep
clipped away to deep square leg
bottom hand comes off the bat as Morkel jams a back of a length delivery onto Dilshan's splice
full, almost a yorker, angled into him. whipped away to deep square leg and that will be drinks
short ball and Dilshan takes it on. Pulls and keeps it down to deep square leg
impressive wristwork there from Sanga, derives most of his power from that and the little flick off the hips travels almost to the boundary before long leg can cut it off
steps down, but sounds his intentions early. McLaren pulls his length back and keeps it to a single to midwicket
short and wide but Dilshan can't quite reach with his cut shot
another flirt outside off as he tries to find third man. McLaren uses the scrambled seam and gets a bit of extra bounce to beat the batsman
goes for a cut and gets it off the bottom of the bat, single in front of point as Duminy dives spectacularly to his right to try and prevent it
he just can't help himself outside off. Width on offer and he goes for a lash over point. Nowhere near connecting
fullish delivery on middle, Dilshan pushes down to mid-on

they've kept teasing him and teasing him and finally Dilshan manages a thick outside edge through to the keeper. Another short and wide delivery that he chased without any footwork to end a useful little innings
tries the sucker plot again, but Mahela gets on top of the bounce with a cut to deep third man
predictably it's short and it rises a little too high to trouble Sanga too much. Easily ducked under
whipped away to long leg as Morkel overdoes the angle, and that brings up Sri Lanka's hundred
good length ball on off stump, Sanga tries to steer it but gets an inside edge. He was worried it was going for his stumps, but it bounces away from the timber
touch too straight and Sanga is able to nudge it behind square leg
he was looking for third man and finds him with a bit of an outside edge. Probing fullish length outside off from Steyn
good length on middle and leg, flicked away to deep midwicket

goes for the bouncer, but this is not the pitch for that king of bowling but  somehow Steyn has managed to beat Sanga with his pace. He was late on the shot . Sanga swivels on his back foot and gloves it to the fine leg boundary.
good length ball on off stump, blocks
calmly tapped into the midwicket region
lovely little cut shot as Sanga waits on the short ball, should have waited on it a little more though as he finds point
flighted outside off, pushed to extra cover
this time he brings down a straighter blade and finds long-off
nicely flighted, but its on the pads and Mahela can work it to short fine leg
goes back as he shortens the length further and punches through to the sweeper on the off side
just short of a good length and angled across the left-hander. Goes for a dab behind point and is beaten
good length ball on off stump, defended solidly
amazing work from Duminy at point. This had a bit of width and Sanga had went back and cut it to the left of point. But Duminy is very sharp there, dives to his right and keeps it to a single
magnificent! This was asking to be driven from Steyn, full and wide. But Mahela obliges ever so politely. Caressed through the covers
goes short this time and Mahela lets it run off his horizontal bat square of third man
fullish on off stump, Mahela blocks
nimble footwork takes him down the pitch and envisages a nudge through wide of long-on
pitches on a good length on leg stump and turns away. He wants to glance it away fine but can't
lovely sweep there, got right over the top of the bounce and kept it all along the carpet.
tossed up on leg stump and Sanga has eased it between deep midwicket and long-on
well bowled by Duminy. Keeps to a good, but not too full length on off stump, Defended
got a little too close to the ball as he came down the track and AB runs across to his left from extra cover and keeps it to nothing. Dodgy back and all
tight length on off stump, blocked
full on off stump, Mahela is forward and clips to mid-on
goes short but keeps it on the corridor, Mahela steers it to point with an open face
fullish on off stump, Mahela drives to short cover

Duminy is a live wide at point! Another steer from Mahela and it looked past the fielder, but JP dives and sticks out his left hand. The two batsmen were uncertain and Sanga was halfway down the pitch. Duminy gets to his feet as quick as he can but the throw is wide. Still, breathtaking work
this time Mahela waits on it a little more and gets it well fine of Duminy

he's struck straight away! Brilliant catch from the keeper! It was short, it needed to be cut but Mahela only manages a healthy edge which de Kock pouches very safely. South Africa's top-notch fielding comes to their rescue again
this one was a little too full to be cut, and it was the googly too. Priyanjan plays a poor shot and the ball bounces over his bat
flighted on middle, eased down to long-on
beats Sanga with a googly. The batsman had picked it but had underestimated the turn. Lovely delivery from Tahir
this not so much. Sanga backs away and cuts the short ball off the stumps to the backward point boundary. Calmly done
this goes straight through Duminy. He's had such a good day in the field it seems comical that he would miss such a straight forward save. Couple to Sanga off a flowing drive through the covers
full on off stump, drilled down the ground for a single
advances and punches the good length ball down the ground. Philander gets a hand to it and mid-on comes in to help, cover backs up. South Africa on the hunt again
opens the face to the good length ball outside off and steers this through to the sweeper
a touch short and Priyanjan goes for the pull. Gets an inside edge towards long-on off a pull
that was nicely done. A little bit of width and he offers an angled face towards third man
goes for a bouncer and he knows he has to dig it in quite hard, rises too far above the batsman's head
another no-ball from Philander. Got the inside edge from Sanga as he was looking to drive on the up. Priyanjan, the new batsman, to take the free hit
goes for the slow, short ball - like he did last time too - gets it nice and high and foils the batsman's pull. Only a single towards the vacant square leg region
that was quick and flat and the perfect answer to an advancing batsman. Priyanjan does well as he brings an angled bat down quickly and sneaks a single into the covers
short ball on middle, Sanga pulls to deep midwicket. No change in his tactics against Tahir it seems

rush of blood and Tahir has set off for his customary run. Taps his chest in delight after luring the outside edge. Absolutely awful shot from Priyanjan as he danced down the track and went for a slog sweep against the turn. Ends up giving an asy catch to short third man
tossed up on middle, pushed down to long-on
that skidded through and kept low too. Sanga's cut connects just in time
nudged away into the midwicket to retain strike
poor star there as he angles a length ball on the pads, Sanga clips it through midwicket quite crisply, Much needed boundary for Sri Lanka
fullish and outside off, Sanga leans forward to drive to cover
drilled down to mid-on as this is full and on off stump

that was a brute from Morkel. Dug in short and jags back sharply on Sanga, who was rooted to the spot. It loops off the splice, hits his chest and balloons up towards the cordon. Keeper rushes in to take it, but falls agonisingly short of his dive. Wonder if slip might have had a better chance
good length ball on middle and off, flicked away to deep square leg
uses Morkel's extra pace there as he shuffles across and tickles the short ball down to the long leg boundary
tossed up on off stump, Sanga eases it down to long-off to raise his fifty. Well-built innings
flighted on off stump and it turns into him, Mathews gets an inside edge towards square leg
drives this flighted ball down to long-off and then asks for a new pair of gloves
lovely legspinner on middle and off, with a little drift in. Defended
pushes this through and it turns the other way again, flicked away to short fine leg
low full toss and he finds the fielder at extra cover. Should have put a lot more into that drive
short of a length and just outside off, Mathews taps it into the covers and rushes across to the other end
back of a length and angled into Sanga's body, flicked away behind square leg
good length ball on off stump, Mathews defends down the pitch
gets forward to one that bounces a little more than he expected. Gets an outside edge down to third man
goes for a bouncer and gets it around the batsman's throat, but Sanga does well as he rolls his wrists to keep the pull down
fullish on off stump, Mathews pushes to mid-off and sets off. Philander was a touch slow to respond
flighted just outside off, Mathews lunges forward and blocks
shortish and outside off, Sanga goes back and cuts but doesn't find the gap
eases into a drive to long-off as this is tossed up a little further
pushed to long-off, looks like they've taken a step back from Tahir
and it is confirmed when he lobs up a full toss and Sanga can only hack it down to deep midwicket
quicker and flatter, Mathews punches it down to long-off and that will be drinks
tries to pepper Mathews, but this seems to have gone over the head of Mathews. Square leg umpire agrees
huge strike for Morkel as he induces the outside edge of a man in prime form! Loose shot from Mathews as he threw his bat at one outside his off stump and the keeper takes a regulation catch.
good length ball just outside off, he covers the line and blocks
shuffles right across to his off stump and blocks the fuller delivery outside off.
switches over the wicket and bowls on the hips of the batsman and Thirimanne is off the mark with a neat flick through square leg
moves around the wicket again and this is on a length outside off, Thirimanne shoulders arms
steers the full toss outside off to deep third man
on a good length outside off, Thirimanne steers behind point
skips down the track, but the bowler does well not offering Sanga the opportunity to get under him. Defended
width on offer and Sanga slices it through to the sweeper
caught between attack and defense and he gets a thick bottom edge off the forceful push
this one skids off the deck and ducks back in with the arm. Just about blocked it
good length and he pushes it to the covers

shuffles across and flicks the good length ball to deep square leg. He wants a couple and sets off and is halfway down the track without listening to Sanga's call of "no". The throw is at the keeper's end so he's safe
skips down and works this away wide of long-on.
tempts him into a drive away from the body and almost succeeds in getting rid of him. The uppish drive falls about a foot or so short of point
fullish on middle, he jumps across to off stump and flicks to midwicket
goes for a bouncer, but its to the wrong batsman. Sanga pulls and controls it quite well to deep square leg
this is the slower ball, Thirimanne saw it early and punched the offcutter to point
drops this short and Sanga pounces on it. Good thing South Africa have a man at deep midwicket
goes back to a flighted ball and clips it wide of long-on

that was noticeably round-arm but Sanga wasn't perturbed. Pushes down the ground. AB runs from extra cover and dives and takes aim somewhere at midwicket! Holds onto the ball though and offeres a wry grin
clipped straight of midwicket
down the track and turns it away into the leg side
a little short and he goes back and punches towards cover point
clips away to deep square leg
fullish and outside off, Sanga has heaved it down to long-on.
little too close to attempt that bottom-handed steer and he's beaten
goes for the pull when Philander goes short, connects well enough
slower ball, on back of a length, Sanga goes for a pull but mistimes it
that's a better bouncer from Philander, gets it to rise nice and high and Thirimanne lets it go
that's the one he was looking for. Short and angled a little too far down leg and Sanga pulls it between short fine leg and square leg
yorks himself as he comes down the track and jams the ball onto his boot off the flick
goes round-arm again but Sanga skips down and drills him to long-on
this one doesn't turn and Thirimanne reads it off the pitch to cut it to deep point
kept on a good length on middle, pushed down the ground but Duminy halts the progress
whips this good length ball away to deep midwicket
what a start! Sanga has charged down the track to a length ball and hammered it over the head of midwicket. Miles above AB and thuds into the advertising hoardings
bad ball again and Sanga swivels on the back foot and just helps it on its way to the boundary behind square leg. Magnificent strike

his line is all wrong here. McLaren was so tidy in his first spell but here he is bowling down leg and Sanga is helping himself to fours left right and centre. Down the track and then pulled to the long leg boundary
goes full on off stump, squeezes it out to mid-on who is quite deep
another short ball and Thirimanne pulls strongly to deep square leg
this is a low full toss and Sanga gets it off the bottom of the bat and the loft falls short of mif-off
just back of a length and tucking him up on leg stump, Sanga mistimes a pull into the mdiwicket region
the restrictive line helps Thirimanne get a boundary to long leg off his thigh pad.

he's dropped it! Steyn has his mouth covered by his hand! This was a fuller ball outside off, Thirimanne looked to force it through the covers and gets a thick edge that goes low to the keeper. De Kock had his hands under it but then spilled it. Steyn is considerably disgruntled
good length ball carved away past point.
he's laced this through point and cover! That's an excellent strike from Sanga, backed away and threaded it past Duminy's despairing dive
goes for the yorker just outside off, Sanga can't squeeze it out

bowled him! This was full and straight and he goes for a hoick across the line. Sanga was hitting wonderfully at the other end. He threw his head back at the non-strikers' That was not the shot to play, especially considering you expose the tail
flicked away from off stump for a single to long leg

this is right off the bottom of the bat, it's a steepler but extra cover has got under it. It was full and just a touch too wide and made him reach for it. Magnificent innings from Sanga, but the demands of Duckworth and Lewis and a resurgent South Africa pace attack get to him
dabbed away past the lone slip to the third man boundary. Deft little stroke there
another short ball and Senanayake has steered it nicely to third man again. This time it's just a single
can't beat slip this time. Kallis dives to his right and does his bit to add further pressure on the hosts. The par score is 254 now. Sri Lanka way behind
enough width for Senanayake to slice it behind point. Steyn ventured a little fuller than his traditional back of a length
off you go, says Styen as Kulasekara goes for a dab to third man and chops a short ball well outside off onto his stumps. The crowd in Colombo is stunned
straight away comes down the track and misses the wild waft outside off
that's a menacing bouncer to the tailender who manages to duck under it. Right over off stump there
deceives him with a lovely slower ball, too good for Mendis as he looks to launch it down the ground. Doesn't connect
how did that miss the off stump? It was a good length ball and Mendis continues on his merry way backing away and going for the loft over the off side. Misses comprehensively again

goes for the googly and this skids onto him and raps him on the pads. He was rooted to the crease while going for a flick, might have drifted down leg which is why the the umpire says no and AB declines to review
how bout that, the stumps are rattled and its the googly again! Senanayake pushed at the ball gingerly, he did not pick it at all and has to walk back
comes down the track which makes Tahir shorten the length of his googly. Malinga bunts it down to the bowler
this one is into orbit. Uses his feet and launches this over long-on to bring up the first six of Sri Lanka's innings
sneaks in a quicker delivery and Malinga, who was down the pitch, manages to skew it to backward point
another wrong 'un, quick and flat, and Malinga seems to have picked it as he pulls to midwicket
shortish and outside off, Malinga backs away to flat bat it down the ground. Mistimed
goes for the yorker, but it is just a little too full and outside off. Mendis sets up for a swipe over cover and is beaten

this is a mistimed hoick, McLaren gets under a swirler and South Africa take the first game in convincing fashion. Steyn goes short and Mendis backs away to try and smoke it out of the park but has fell way off the mark
